content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Le problème est simple et bien posé, facile à résoudre avec un niveau mathématique de fin de lycée.

Hi,

Nice and simple combinatory problem ; I would have added a few more tests and validators with higher number, just to check that the player used the right formula.
For instance, print(math.comb(n, a)) will pass all the validators and 3/4 tests.

Why not propose later a level 2 of this puzzle, this time with a + b > n ?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: If you're familiar with combinatorics it takes you few seconds. If not you can learn a new concept with an easy application within 10 minutes :)
Simple but efficient clash of code in my opinion.

There's really not enough test cases here at the moment.

I would add at least 3 more. With the newer tests approaching the n=10 limit.

I can't approve it in this form, because it's really not easy to see the pattern yet, and lots of bad solutions could still get 75% with only the 4 current validators.
If you approve it, I will make something more interesting soon... Thank you!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I would approve a Reverse version too if the testcases were designed specifically for it.

Goal
* Please rewrite as follows:

There are [[n]] seats, and each can hold at most one person. How many ways are there to place [[a]] boys and [[b]] girls on the seats? Assume that all boys are indistinguishable from one another, and so are all girls.

Input
* Please rewrite as follows:

<<Line 1>>: 3 space-separated integers [[n]], [[a]] and [[b]] for the number of seats, boys and girls respectively

Constraints
* Please change "N" to "n" for consistency.

* Please add "1 <=" to the second constraint.

* Please format "n", "a" and "b" as [[variables]].

Stub generator
* Please change Line 1 to:
read n:int a:int b:int

Thanks.

I don't get a notification if you don't reply directly.

Also, you haven't formatted the variables in Constraints section yet. Use the [[ ]] syntax. Thanks.
Since you pointed out problems with the submission, it would have been better to not approve it until it's fixed.
